system_prompt:
You are an expert assistant for searching and analyzing completed Kaggle competitions.

    Your task is to retrieve Kaggle competitions that match the user’s query in a
    MAXIMALLY INCLUSIVE and CONSISTENT way.

    GENERAL RULES (apply to ALL queries):
    - Always prioritize recall over precision in retrieval.
    - NEVER silently exclude a competition if it partially matches the query.
    - If relevance is ambiguous, INCLUDE the competition and label the ambiguity.
    - Do NOT optimize for brevity or “best” results.
    - The same query must yield the same set of competitions.

    RETRIEVAL STRATEGY (mandatory two-phase process):

    PHASE 1 — Broad Retrieval
    - Retrieve ALL completed Kaggle competitions that may reasonably match the query,
    including:
    - Direct matches
    - Indirect or weak matches
    - Domain-adjacent competitions
    - Apply numeric constraints (e.g., number of solutions > N) only if they are
    explicitly stated in the query.
    - Do NOT filter by subjective notions such as “not notable” or “less relevant”.

    PHASE 2 — Classification (DO NOT REMOVE RESULTS)
    For each retrieved competition, explicitly label:
    - Relevance Level:
    - Strong Match
    - Partial / Indirect Match
    - Weak Match
    - Reason for inclusion

    COMPETITION DETAILS (for EACH competition):
    - Competition name
    - Competition URL
    - Evaluation metric
    - Total number of solution writeups (best-effort estimation)
    - List ALL available solution writeups:
    - Rank or placement (if available)
    - Title or brief description
    - Direct link
    - If the total number is uncertain, state the uncertainty explicitly.

    OUTPUT RULES:
    - Do NOT summarize or highlight only notable solutions.
    - Do NOT remove competitions during classification.
    - Preserve a stable and deterministic ordering:
    1. Strong Match
    2. Partial / Indirect Match
    3. Weak Match
    - Within each group, order by number of solutions (descending).

    FAILURE HANDLING:
    - If no competition matches, explain why and suggest query refinements.
    - If data is incomplete or inferred, clearly state assumptions.

    TRANSPARENCY:
    - Explicitly state when judgment or inference is used.
    - Never hallucinate links or competitions.

parts.content:
Here are the completed Kaggle competitions related to "Image Classification":

### Strong Match

1. **Cdiscount’s Image Classification Challenge**
   - **Competition URL:** [Cdiscount’s Image Classification Challenge](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge)
   - **Evaluation Metric:** Categorization Accuracy
   - **Total Number of Solution Writeups:** 6
   - **List of Available Solution Writeups:**
     - **Rank:** 1, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge/discussion/45863)
     - **Rank:** 2, **Title:** Code, **Link:** [Link](https://github.com/miha-skalic/convolutedPredictions_Cdiscount)
     - **Rank:** 2, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge/discussion/45709)
     - **Rank:** 7, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge/discussion/45737)
     - **Rank:** 9, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge/discussion/45721)
     - **Rank:** 12, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cdiscount-image-classification-challenge/discussion/45798)

2. **Recursion Cellular Image Classification**
   - **Competition URL:** [Recursion Cellular Image Classification](https://www.kaggle.com/c/recursion-cellular-image-classification)
   - **Evaluation Metric:** Categorization Accuracy
   - **Total Number of Solution Writeups:** 14

     - **Rank:** 14, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/recursion-cellular-image-classification/discussion/110390)
     - **Rank:** 16, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/recursion-cellular-image-classification/discussion/110361)
     - **Rank:** 41, **Title:** Code, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/recursion-cellular-image-classification/discussion/110444)
     - **Rank:** All solutions summary, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/recursion-cellular-image-classification/discussion/110376)

### Partial / Indirect Match

1. **CIFAR-10 - Object Recognition in Images**
   - **Competition URL:** [CIFAR-10 - Object Recognition in Images](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cifar-10)
   - **Evaluation Metric:** Categorization Accuracy
   - **Total Number of Solution Writeups:** 2
   - **List of Available Solution Writeups:**
     - **Rank:** 1, **Title:** Code, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/cifar-10/discussion/10493)
     - **Rank:** 5, **Title:** Code, **Link:** [Link](https://github.com/nagadomi/kaggle-cifar10-torch7)

### Weak Match

1. **Open Images 2019 - Object Detection**
   - **Competition URL:** [Open Images 2019 - Object Detection](https://www.kaggle.com/c/open-images-2019-object-detection)

     - **Rank:** 31, **Title:** Description, **Link:** [Link](https://www.kaggle.com/c/open-images-2019-object-detection/discussion/111022)

2. **Open Images 2019 - Instance Segmentation**

This collection includes a range of competitions that either directly address image classification or are closely related through object detection and recognition tasks.
